allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Phase 1: Fix code issues and add comprehensive error handling

- Fix incorrect null handling in Notification.hot\(\) using proper if statement
- Add handling for CardioAvailability messages in MonitorData
- Add validation and documentation to AlertPattern class
- Add error handling and logging throughout:
  - HealthServicesRepository: handle exceptions in capability checks and measure callbacks
  - Haptics: validate pattern data before sending vibration commands
  - CardioDataViewModel: handle empty data lists and collection errors
  - MonitorData: wrap flows in try-catch with proper logging
- Add Java toolchain configuration for Gradle compatibility
- Improve logging for debugging heart rate monitoring issues

Acceptance criteria:
✓ Fixed code quality issues
✓ Added comprehensive error handling
✓ Meaningful error messages and logging added
✓ No unhandled exceptions in core paths
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Phase 2: Add user-configurable heart rate thresholds

- Create UserPreferences class with DataStore for persistent settings
- Add SettingsScreen UI for configuring min/max heart rate thresholds
- Add string resources for settings screen and error messages
- Update Notification class with factory method for user preferences
- Update CardioDataViewModel to manage settings state and preferences
- Update ViewModelFactory to support UserPreferences injection
- Add methods to save and load user preferences
- Integrate preferences loading on app initialization

Acceptance criteria:
✓ User can input custom min/max HR thresholds
✓ Settings persist after app restart \(using DataStore\)
✓ Input validation with clear error messages
✓ UI shows current threshold values
✓ Settings can be toggled on/off in app
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Phase 2: Implement configurable haptic patterns

- Create HapticPatterns object with 6 predefined patterns:
  Short Tap, Long Vibration, Pulse, Double Tap, Wave, Emergency
- Add HapticPatternScreen UI for pattern selection and preview
- Add haptic pattern and cooldown storage to UserPreferences
- Update ViewModel to manage pattern selection state
- Add pattern preference loading on app initialization
- Add methods to select patterns and persist selection
- Add string resources for haptic pattern UI

Acceptance criteria:
✓ User can choose from multiple predefined patterns
✓ Selection is saved and persists
✓ Pattern plays correctly when threshold is crossed
✓ At least 3 distinct patterns available
✓ UI shows current selected pattern
EOF
\)")
